Container.Name: Nextcloud-cronjob
Container.Overview: Nextcloud cron job runner. The official Nextcloud Docker container needs something external to run its cron jobs reliably, this is a simple solution to this problem to avoid having to delve into user scripts. Make sure to select "Cron (Recommended)" for the Background Jobs option in your nextcloud instance's Basic Settings.
Container.Changes:
### 2022-10-12 - Add script path for 3rd party containers e.g. LSIO
### 2022-08-11 - Initial release

Config.Name: NEXTCLOUD_CONTAINER_NAME
Config.Description: The name of your nextcloud container

Config.Name: NEXTCLOUD_CRON_MINUTE_INTERVAL
Config.Description: How often to run the cron jobs, in minutes

Config.Name: NEXTCLOUD_EXEC_USER
Config.Description: The user to run the job as in the nextcloud container

Config.Name: NEXTCLOUD_EXEC_SHELL
Config.Description: Which shell to use in the nextcloud container

Config.Name: Scripts path
Config.Description: Scripts placed in this folder will be executed along with the default command. Use if your Nextcloud container has cron.php in a different location than the official container. E.g. for LSIO map this to a folder, and create a .sh script in it containing: php -f /config/www/nextcloud/cron.php
